name: noq
readme:
noQ: Micro promises library, designed for full compatibility with a minimum subset of the 'q' library (http://github.com/kriskowal/q), which happens to be the only subset I use (and is sufficient for most cases.)
Differs in two primary regards: predictability of function and configurable exception absorption.
Q's main shortcoming is that it's easy to get into hard-to-debug failure cases. noQ will noisily warn you if resolved promises are unhandled.

var Q = require('noq').noTry;
